subject: Business
title: Crisis Communication Principles
description: A short lesson to help you apply Crisis Communication Principles.

hook.text: In 1982, seven people died from poisoned Tylenol. Johnson & Johnson recalled 31 million bottles immediately.

buildup.text: Crisis communication has three rules: be first, be right, be credible.

discovery.text: Silence in a crisis creates a vacuum that rumors and speculation fill instantly.

twist.text: Boeing tried to minimize the 737 MAX crisis. The cover-up destroyed more trust than the crashes themselves.

climax.text: Transparency, speed, and accountability define whether a company survives a crisis or is defined by it.

punchline.text: In a crisis, what you say first is remembered.

quiz.question: What are the three rules of crisis communication?
options: Be first, be right, be credible
Be quiet, be cautious, be legal
Be optimistic, be vague, be patient
